Indeed, to estimate the LD 50 and the LT 50, the percentages of mortality were transformed in probits and the concentrations and time in decimal logarithm. These transformations have allowed us to establish equations for regression lines “probit-logarithm” of type:
(4)
y = a x + b ,
where y is the corrected mortality probits, x is the logarithm of the dose or time, and a is the slope.
